head.title: Federal Home Loan Banks Offer $875 Million in Bonds

hedline.hl1: Federal Home Loan Banks Offer $875 Million in Bonds

block.p: LEAD: The Federal Home Loan Bank System, a network of 12 regional banks that lend money to savings and loan associations, tapped the securities market yesterday with an $875 million offering at par of one-year and two-year bonds through various securities dealers.

LEAD: The Federal Home Loan Bank System, a network of 12 regional banks that lend money to savings and loan associations, tapped the securities market yesterday with an $875 million offering at par of one-year and two-year bonds through various securities dealers.

The Federal Home Loan Bank System, a network of 12 regional banks that lend money to savings and loan associations, tapped the securities market yesterday with an $875 million offering at par of one-year and two-year bonds through various securities dealers.

A $435 million issue of one-year bonds due in 1991 was priced to yield 8.375 percent, or about a basis point more than Treasury securities with a similar maturity. A basis point is one-hundredth of a percentage point.

The remaining $440 million in two-year bonds were priced to yield 8.60 percent, or about 7 basis points more than Treasuries. The dealers said the first interest payment for the one-year bond is Nov. 28 and the first for the two-year bond is Nov. 26.
